184890093.review:
You ever just sit there one day, and unlock a memory from your childhood, and then replay the game tied to that memory and it just doesn't hit the same? Well, that didn't happen with this peak video game . . . .

I remember playing this on the Wii for hours at a time and getting lost. My sister had played LEGO Batman with me but didn't like the LEGO men having voices and stuff or the split screen the sequel brought, so I played it alone, but like... 6-year-old Harry felt like Batman AND Superman and it was because of this game.

Replaying it was super fun, I've replayed the first game a few times, between friends, my sister and a solo playthrough, but like... OUGH. LEGO Batman 2 isn't the best of the trilogy, but it's close. I just wish there was more villain side content, like the villain missions from the first mission... Because everyone knows that if you played Batman you were cool, but if you played the Joggler... You were truly jorkin it all the way to the bank.

I got this as a gift many moons ago

184810089.review:
Esta reseña es muy honesta y uso mi opinión personal aquí y de ser la primera vez que lo juego así que si no te gusta lo que leíste pido perdón de antemano. aquí la reseña:

La verdad lego batman 2 es un muy buen juego pero siento que la gente lo sobrevalora mucho, ya que si bien es un buen juego y muy recomendado, pero no al nivel que la gente dice es un juego que en historia es muy corto en comparación con el primer juego este tiene 15 niveles unas digamos 5-7 horas si vas muy rápido pero en lego batman 1 tiene 30 pero separado en las dos historias que ofrece el juego, aun que la ventaja que tiene lego batman 2 es que la mayoría de niveles son muy largos con checkpoin en ciertas partes lo cual no es malo y se hace ameno si es que no vas muy rápido, en cuanto el mundo abierto esta muy bien hecho y recrea bien la ciudad de gotham y hay secretos y coleccionables que si eres como yo que lo completas al 100% te dara horas de diversión, pero lo que no me gusto es el manejo de los personajes voladores y helicópteros que llega a ser tosca mas con los personajes voladores que al subir en el mundo abierto es muy malo no se si hay otra forma pero la que use es bastante mala y créeme que lo usaras mucho ya sea por historia o por el 100% en gotham en los niveles son bastante buenos pero en gotham es otra historia, que hablando de la historia honestamente la sentí pesada en la parte final no es mala historia pero cuando llega el robot de joker y luthor a gotham se puede llegar a ser pesada almeno en mi caso y otra cosa que no me gusto es la aparición de la liga de la justicia o mejor dicho la tardía aparición ya que cuando vi el titulo del juego DC Super Heroes pensé que en un punto de la historia aparecería la liga de la justicia para ayudar a batman y superman y en los últimos dos niveles es un error mio de pensar en eso pero honestamente no gusto eso, pero mas haya de todo esto que estoy relatando es un buen juego y recomendado pero no es ese juego que esperaba cuando escuchaba la gente diciendo que este juego es "tal y esto es un juegazo" pero si esta al nivel de superar a su precuela y de ser posiblemente volverte tu favorito.

MUY RECOMENDADO 9/10

184473156.review:
LEGO® Batman™ 2: DC Super Heroes – A Superpowered LEGO Adventure

LEGO® Batman™ 2: DC Super Heroes, developed by TT Games, elevates the LEGO franchise by introducing open-world gameplay and voice acting, a first for LEGO titles. This sequel expands beyond Gotham, bringing together iconic DC characters like Superman, Wonder Woman, and The Flash to stop Lex Luthor and the Joker from wreaking havoc.

The story is engaging, blending TT Games’ trademark humor with a compelling superhero narrative. The interactions between Batman’s brooding personality and Superman’s optimism provide plenty of laughs, while the addition of voice acting adds depth to the characters. The plot is straightforward but effective, with a mix of classic DC heroics and LEGO’s playful charm.

Gameplay strikes a balance between exploration, combat, and puzzle-solving. The open-world Gotham City is a highlight, offering players the freedom to roam, complete side quests, and discover secrets. Each character’s unique abilities, like Superman’s flight or Batman’s gadgets, add variety and encourage experimentation. However, the controls can sometimes feel clunky, particularly during flight sequences, which may frustrate players.

Visually, the game captures the essence of Gotham and DC heroes in LEGO form, with detailed environments and a vibrant color palette. Yet, the camera can occasionally be a nuisance, especially in tight spaces. Co-op play is enjoyable but suffers from split-screen issues, making navigation confusing at times.

Overall, LEGO® Batman™ 2: DC Super Heroes is a delightful mix of humor, action, and exploration. While it has minor technical flaws, it remains a must-play for LEGO and DC fans alike.

Score: 85/100

183843070.review:
Lego Batman 2 is an excellent next step from Lego Batman 1. Everything that made the first game a blast makes a return here along with plenty of great new additions.

To start with what has returned, the game once again has a great cast of characters and vehicles, Batman and Robin showcase tons of wacky abilities that feel straight out of the 60s TV show, and there's tons to appreciate in each character's animations and weapons.

This game adds Gotham as a vast hub world to explore with hundreds of collectibles scattered about, and exploring the city in all of your unlocked vehicles is a great experience (a major step up from the older Lego games where you could only use vehicles in their god awful vehicle levels). Also, this game has an original story! Complete with great cutscenes, animations, and voice acting! The missions all feel more grandiose because of it, and it feels like I'm actually doing something to save Gotham compared to the first game where I'm just aimlessly catching villains in their hideouts.

The game still has its downsides, though. For one, while I do like an open world with collectibles, getting every collectible available is a [i]grind[/i]. This doesn't matter much if you're not going for 100%, but most people are when playing Lego games; it's kinda their schtick. Some of Batman and Robin's abilities are tedious to use, especially Robin's water hose, but you won't be needing them most of the time fortunately.

Lastly (and also the biggest downside), every villain besides the Joker and Lex Luthor get sidelined in this game: after the first mission, you never see any of them again in the story. So all of Two Face, the Riddler, Harley Quinn, the Penguin, and all other big names pretty much don't exist outside of being an optional character to play as during free play.

183549070.review:
Pros:
+ Very Awesome Open World Hub
+ Useful Extras
+ Lots of Characters and Vehicles to Unlock
+ Epic Soundtrack
+ The Superman Theme plays when flying around as him
+ Awesome Super Suits for Batman and Robin
+ High Replay Value
+ LEGO Gotham City is a fantastic bonus level

Cons:
- Chemical Crisis is hard and overly long
- Button Mashes Galore
- Collecting Minikits, Gold Bricks, Red Bricks, and rescuing Citizens in Peril is repetitive
- A crash occurred during Underground Retreat, but I was still able to complete it
- Several characters and vehicles are expensive
- No option to buy the DLCs
- You can't get Supergirl until you find all 250 Gold Bricks, and Harley Quinn's Motorbike is only unlocked by obtaining 100% completion
- The rainbow glitch in the first level renders the game unplayable on Steam Deck
